summary: This document is an email from Chris DiIorio forwarding a formal appeal regarding SEC denial of a whistleblower claim (2015-016) related to Knight Capital. It contains allegations of SEC corruption, securities fraud, and money laundering involving shell companies, investment funds, and specific individuals and entities. The author accuses the SEC of facilitating fraud and harming whistleblowers and public investors.

keyFacts: The author, Chris DiIorio, is a whistleblower who filed a formal appeal (2015-016) with the SEC related to Knight Capital and alleges the SEC is a corrupt organization facilitating fraud.
An SEC complaint alleges Ofer Abarbanel transferred approximately $102 million from investor funds into NARL accounts via a fund from March 2019 to November 2020.

The author claims the SEC complaint omitted key figures like Nicholas Abbate (COO of the receiving State Fund), Brown Brothers Harriman, and Mosaic/Old Fort, and made no reference to Anti-Money Laundering (AML).
The document connects individuals like 'prolific Bag Man' Honig to Russian entities, Signature Bank (SBNY), and the law firm Sichenzia Ross.
It details a business transaction where Northern Data AG, founded by ex-private banker Mathis Schultz, sold its Texas data center to RIOT Blockchain and holds a 12% stake in RIOT.
